intro: Quillaja poeppigii, commonly known as the Andean spongewood, is a tree native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its thick, cork-like bark that contains saponins. The plant typically grows in temperate climates and can reach heights of up to 20 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a serrated margin. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody capsules containing several seeds.
